snippet: The trouble began after an insult from the governor, but observers of Azerbaijani politics said that was little more than a pretext for residents to vent the anger they already felt.
abstract: Angry protesters gather outside the home of provincial governor, Rauf Gabibov, in a rare outbreak of civil unrest in Azerbaijan and demand his ouster as the house is consumed in flames, apparently the result of an arson attack; trouble started when Gabibov said in a televised interview that residents of the Quba district in northern Azerbaijan were 'sell-outs,' in reference to sales of houses in a mountain resort area.
lead_paragraph: The trouble began after an insult from the governor, but observers of Azerbaijani politics said that was little more than a pretext for residents to vent the anger they already felt.

headline.main: Azerbaijan’s Leaders Yield After a Rare Public Protest
headline.print_headline: Azerbaijan’s Leaders Yield After a Rare Public Protest
